caption:
This photograph depicts a close-up shot of a wristwatch prominently displayed in the foreground. The watch has a detailed, classic design featuring a dark face with gold markings and hands, along with multiple smaller dials within its main face suggesting additional functionalities like a chronograph. The watch's body and band are also finished in gold tones, enhancing its elegant appearance.

The background of the image is out of focus, creating a bokeh effect with various colored lights. These blurred lights vary in size and intensity, showing a palette of white, yellow, red, and green, hinting at a nighttime setting possibly in an urban environment with streetlights or illuminated signs in the distance. The use of shallow depth of field places all the emphasis on the watch, suggesting a moment captured, possibly signifying the importance of time in that instance. There's a subtle reflection on the glass of the watch, adding to the overall moody and atmospheric quality of the image.
title: This night scene was taken at 7:45 p.m. after all commercial and neon lights were turned off September 29, 1973, by executive order from Governor Tom McCall to ease the energy shortage in the state.
